Trial_Design.evidence: Parents of children scheduled to undergo an elective surgical procedure (N=408) were randomized

Participants.evidence: Parents of children scheduled to undergo an elective surgical procedure

Intervention.evidence: randomized to receive information about the risks and benefits of a sham study of postoperative pain control using text, tables, or pictographs

Objective.evidence: We examined the effect of tabular and graphical presentation of risks and benefits on parents’ understanding of a research study.

Method_Outcome.evidence: completed a questionnaire to examine their gist (essential) and verbatim (actual) understanding of the information

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Parents of children scheduled to undergo an elective surgical procedure (N=408) were randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: Parents of children scheduled to undergo an elective surgical procedure (N=408) were randomized

Result_Outcome.evidence: Parents randomized to receive information using tables or pictographs had significantly (P<0.025) greater gist and verbatim understanding compared with parents who received the information using standard text.
